intro: Cinnagrostis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable willow-herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its alternate, simple, and often hairy leaves that vary in shape along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with prominent sepals and reduced petals. It typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes, stream banks, and wet meadows. Cinnagrostis heterophylla is native to North America and is often found in temperate regions.
